title: Black's picturesque tourist of Scotland.
snippet: On the opposite bank of the Tweed is Milne-Graden (D. Milne Home, Esq.), once the seat of the Kerrs of Graden, and, at an earlier period, the residence of the chief of a Border clan, known by the name of Graden.

title: Black's picturesque tourist of Scotland.
snippet: On the opposite bank of the Tweed is Milne-Graden (D. Milne Home, Esq.), once the seat of the Kerrs of Graden, and, at an earlier period, the residence of the chief of a Border clan, known by the name of Graden.

title: Tales of a Grandfather ... [ser. 1-3.] With notes.
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: Colonel Ker of Gradennearly surprised a party of English dragoons, and made prisoner one Weir, a principal spy of the Duke of Cumberland, whom the Highland officers were desirousof sending to instant execution.
